brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of ondansetron to reduce
      cocaine use in subjects with cocaine dependence.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ondansetron for the Treatment of Cocaine Dependence - 1

detailed_description.textblock:
Double-blind, placebo-controlled, 4-parallel group design to assess the efficacy and safety
      of 3 wide range doses of ondansetron to reduce cocaine use in subjects with cocaine
      dependence and to determine the optimal dose of ondansetron.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Male/Female, at least 18 yrs of age; DSM-4 diagnosis of cocaine dependence; seeking
        Treatment for cocaine dependence; have ability to understand, having understood and
        provide written consent; females of child bearing potential that use accepted method of
        birth control

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Additional criteria available during screening at the site.

facility.name: University of Texas Hlth Sci Ctr San Ant

clinical_study.official_title: Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial of Ondansetron for the Treatment of Cocaine Dependence

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double-Blind, Primary Purpose: Treatment
